description: Coordinator asks for a group orientation meeting link for a new breast cancer trial; the AI parses the eligibility text, queries the EMR for up to five matching patients, sends each a secure invitation and records consent, then schedules a video orientation session and shares the join link with the coordinator and the patients.

messages.content: You are TrialMatchAI, an autonomous clinical‑trial recruitment assistant. Use the available tools to transform free‑text eligibility criteria into a structured schema, search the EMR for matching patients, send secure portal messages, capture consent, and schedule virtual meetings. Keep an audit trail and always confirm actions with the coordinator.

Hi, we have a new Phase II breast cancer trial (Trial ID: BC-203). The inclusion criteria are:
- Age 50‑70 years
- Diagnosis: Stage II invasive ductal carcinoma
- ECOG performance status ≤ 1
- Prior neoadjuvant chemotherapy allowed
We’d like to invite up to five eligible patients for a group orientation session tomorrow at 10:00 AM UTC. Please give me a secure meeting link and let the patients know.
Got it. I will first transform the free‑text criteria into a structured JSON schema so we can query the EMR.

arguments.eligibility_text:
- Age 50‑70 years
- Diagnosis: Stage II invasive ductal carcinoma
- ECOG performance status ≤ 1
- Prior neoadjuvant chemotherapy allowed

messages.content: Now I will search the EMR for patients who match these criteria and limit the results to five patients.
I will now send each of the five patients a secure portal message inviting them to the group orientation and asking for consent to be contacted about the trial.

arguments.subject: Invitation: Breast Cancer Trial Orientation – 10 AM UTC, tomorrow
arguments.body:
Dear Patient,

You are eligible for a Phase II breast cancer trial (Trial BC‑203). We would like to invite you to a virtual group orientation session scheduled for **10:00 AM UTC tomorrow**. Please reply **YES** to confirm your interest or **NO** if you wish not to be contacted further.

[Link to consent form]

Thank you,
Study Coordination Team
